meanings.definition: A small organism that feeds on microscopic particles.
meanings.sent1: The tiny microphage searched for its next meal in the pond.
meanings.sent2: Under the microscope, the microphage was seen devouring tiny particles.
meanings.sent3: The microphage threw a tiny party for all the microscopic particles it had eaten.
meanings.sent4: The microphage was like a tiny vacuum cleaner, sucking up all the microscopic debris.
meanings.sent5: In the world of microorganisms, the microphage was known as the tiny predator.

meanings.definition: To consume or destroy small particles or organisms.
meanings.sent1: The amoeba began to microphage the tiny organisms in the water droplet.
meanings.sent2: The bacteria quickly microphaged the food particles in the petri dish.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner seemed to microphage all the crumbs on the floor in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire microphaged everything in its path, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The robot was programmed to microphage any small debris it encountered on the factory floor.
